intro: Meconopsis rebeccae, commonly known as the Scottish Bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Scottish Highlands. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and mountainous regions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Meconopsis rebeccae is considered a conservation concern.
